tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE TrafficData (
  ID INT PRIMARY KEY,
  Date DATE,
  Time TIME,
  Location VARCHAR,
  Speed INT,
  CongestionLevel VARCHAR
);

CREATE TABLE historical_traffic_data (
    route_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    start_location VARCHAR(255),
    end_location VARCHAR(255),
    traffic_volume INT,
    congestion_pattern VARCHAR(100)
);

CREATE TABLE route_planning_data (
    route_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    start_location VARCHAR(255),
    end_location VARCHAR(255),
    planned_route VARCHAR(100),
    estimated_travel_time INT
);

CREATE TABLE historical_traffic_data (
    route_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    date DATE,
    time TIME,
    traffic_volume INT,
    traffic_speed INT
)

CREATE TABLE route_planning (
    route_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    start_location VARCHAR(255),
    end_location VARCHAR(255),
    distance INT,
    road_condition VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE congestion_patterns (
    route_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    congestion_level VARCHAR(20),
    cause VARCHAR(50),
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE traffic_data (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    date DATE,
    time TIME,
    vehicle_type VARCHAR(50),
    speed FLOAT,
    location VARCHAR(100)
);

CREATE TABLE route_planning (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    route_id INT,
    start_location VARCHAR(100),
    end_location VARCHAR(100),
    distance FLOAT,
    duration FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE congestion_patterns (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    pattern_id INT,
    location VARCHAR(100),
    congestion_level VARCHAR(50),
    peak_hours VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE historical_data (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    date DATE,
    location VARCHAR(100),
    traffic_volume INT,
    road_condition VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE congestion_patterns (
	congestion_id INT,
	route_id INT,
	date DATE,
	time TIME,
	congestion_level INT
);
